p: The fractions of R. officinalis by n-hexane and chloroform exhibited MIC value 6.25 μg/ml against MTB H37Ra. Salvia aethiopis L. ethanol extraction and fraction by petroleum ether and chloroform exhibited MIC value at 50 μg/ml against M. tuberculosis H37Ra. S. aintabensis presents activity against four strains of M. tuberculosis with the MIC of 12.5–100 μg/ml and the petroleum ether fractions showed activity against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and H37Ra with MIC of 25 and 50 μg/ml respectively. The ethyl acetate fractions exhibited MIC value of 12.5 μg/ml against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and H37Ra, respectively. The strong properties due to present high quaintity of phenolic compound such as rosmarinic acid, naringenin, hesperidin, luteolin, caffeic acid were investigated. The ethanol extraction for S. sylvatica L and fraction by petroleum ether showed MIC value at 50 μg/ml against M. tuberculosis H37Ra.
